cause.description:
ECSC HISTORY In the summer of 1980 with the Spirit of Harambee, the Ebony City Soccer Club, Lil’ Peles Soccer team was established to provide a vehicle that would help channel the energy of the area youth in a positive direction.
PRINCIPLES OF THE NGUZA SABA UMOJA: Unity KUJICHAGULIA: Self-determination UJMA: Collective work & responsibility UJAMAA: Cooperative economics NIA: Purpose KUUMBA:Creativity IMANI: Faith
Li'l Peles: The Name Derived from the nickname of the undisputed Master of the game, Brazilian born soccer player Edson Arantes do Nascimento (Pele). His background as a youth was one of poverty and a determination to acquire excellence in whatever he participated in.
1. Inner-city youth in Charleston deserve equal access to meaningful recreation
cause.mission: Introduce the game of soccer to inner-city youth while promoting the values of the Nguza Saba
cause.name: Ebony City Soccer & Youth Development Program
